text: NMC Górnik Zabrze, formerly known as Powen Zabrze and Pogoń Zabrze, is a men's handball club from Zabrze, Poland, that plays in the Superliga. == Titles == * Superliga: ** 16px 1st: 1989, 1990 ** 16px 2nd: 1976, 1979, 1988 ** 16px 3rd: 1967, 1985, 1987, 2014 *Cup of Poland : ** 16px 1st: 1984, 1988, 1990 == European record == {| class="wikitable" ! Season ! Competition ! Round ! Club ! 1st leg ! 2nd leg ! Aggregate |- | colspan="7" bgcolor=white| |- | rowspan="2" | 2019–20 | rowspan="2" | EHF Cup | style="text-align:center;"|R2 | Maccabi Rishon LeZion | style="text-align:center;"|29–26 | style="text- align:center;"|21–22 | style="text-align:center;"|50–48 |- | style="text- align:center;"|R3 | SC Magdeburg | style="text-align:center;"|25–37 | style="text-align:center;"|26–37 | style="text-align:center;"|51–74 |} HWS Pogoń == Team == === Current squad === :Squad for the 2020–21 season ;Goalkeepers * 12 Paweł Kazimier * 16 Martin Galia * 33 Jakub Skrzyniarz ;Left Wingers *7 Bartłomiej Tomczak * 14 Jan Czuwara ;Right Wingers *4 Krystian Bondzior * 17 Aliaksandr Bushkou ;Line players *5 Marek Daćko *6 Bartłomiej Bis * 15 Damian Pawelec * 92 Szymon Medwid ;Left Backs * 20 Łukasz Gogola * 77 Patryk Gregułowski * 86 Michał Adamuszek ;Centre Backs * 10 Krzysztof Łyżwa * 23 Adrian Kondratiuk * 32 Paweł Krawczyk ;Right Backs * 11 Iso Sluijters * 31 Paweł Dudkowski === Transfers === :Transfers for the 2020–21 season ;Joining * Paweł Dudkowski (RB) (from Zagłębie Lubin) * Patryk Gluch (RW) (back from loan at Piotrkowianin Piotrków Trybunalski) ;Leaving * Szymon Sićko (LB) (end of loan PGE Vive Kielce) * Alexander Tatarintsev (LB) (to Dinamo Viktor Stavropol) * Rafał Gliński (CB) (retires) * Ignacy Bąk (RB) (to Riihimäki Cocks) * Patryk Gluch (RW) (to Piotrkowianin Piotrków Trybunalski) == External links == *Official website Category:Polish handball clubs Category:Sport in Silesian Voivodeship Category:Handball clubs established in 1947 Category:1947 establishments in Poland
title: NMC Górnik Zabrze
